name: overstimulate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] to make someone too excited or interested in something: In some people the drug may even have the unexpected effect of overstimulating instead of sedating. It is important not to overstimulate children just before bedtime.
[ T ] to have too great an effect on the growth, development, or activity of something : Policymakers need to be careful not to overstimulate the economy when an oil shock hits. Too much fear can overstimulate our imagination: we jump at every creaking floorboard, until it becomes impossible to relax.
[ T ]
  biology
  specialized to cause a part of the body to produce too much of a particular substance or have too great an effect on a process : According to some experts, dairy products can overstimulate the ovaries to produce more oestrogen. A viral infection can overstimulate the immune system, causing problems like inflammation and tissue damage.
